title: Simple Quarto Website
text:
This page demonstrates required Quarto features for the lab. Including headings, columns, lists, tables, math, images, video, Mermaid diagrams, and citations.


Some brief summary text.





This is a bulleted list
With multiple items
Showing markdown basics

Inline math example: the quadratic formula uses \(b^2 - 4ac\) under a square root.




A short paragraph of placeholder text.

“Good documentation is a love letter to your future self.”

CPU-only baseline



Display math (non-inline):
\[
\int_{0}^{1} x^2 \, dx \;=\; \frac{1}{3}
\]



Two embedded images from the local images/ folder:
 



An embedded YouTube video using a responsive iframe:

 





flowchart TD A[Start] –> B{Decision?} B –>|Yes| C[Do this] B –>|No| D[Do that instead] C –> E[Finish] D –> E[Finish]




As noted by Anscombe (2006), philosophy of mind has a long history.
More recently, ethical debates have been reframed in modern contexts Wood (2020).

title: Simple Quarto Website
text:
As noted by Anscombe (2006), philosophy of mind has a long history.
More recently, ethical debates have been reframed in modern contexts Wood (2020).

title: DSAN 5000 — Mini Deck
text:
Welcome
This is a short reveal.js deck made with Quarto + Jupyter Notebook.
I will cite one of our references here: see Anscombe (2006) for background, and a more modern take in Wood (2020).

title: DSAN 5000 — Mini Deck
text:
Key Points

Built with Quarto + reveal.js
Authored as a Jupyter Notebook (.ipynb)
Images, citations, and code supported





Anscombe, G. E. M. 2006. Metaphysics and the Philosophy of Mind. Royal National Institute for the Blind.


Wood, Nathan. 2020. Virtue Rediscovered: Deontology, Consequentialism, and Virtue Ethics in the Contemporary Moral Landscape. Lexington Books.
